alert.note: Alert for Carlton; St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 18 at 1:22PM CST until February 18 at 1:45PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Duluth MN has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... South central St. Louis County in northeastern Minnesota... Northeastern Carlton County in northeastern Minnesota... West central Bayfield County in northwestern Wisconsin... Northern Douglas County in northwestern Wisconsin... * Until 145 PM CST. * At 120 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Superior, to near Mahtowa, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This will affect I-35 between Cloquet and the Twin Ports and US Highway 53 from Superior to Bennett. Locations impacted include... Superior, Cloquet, Hermantown, Proctor, Hawthorne, Lake Nebagamon, Scanlon, Carlton, Maple, Brule, Mahtowa, Poplar, Oulu, Wrenshall, Oliver, Thomson, South Range, Foxboro, Wisconsin Point, and Fond Du Lac Band Cloquet Area. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
